div: If you want to use the application locally only, use Cassini. If you want to expose the application on a web server to your team, use IIS.
To install TEAM Mentor on IIS 7.0 and IIS 7.5:

Copy TEAM Mentor files to local folder
Download the .zip file of TEAM Mentor and extract itYou can also do a 
Git Clone of the latest version of TEAM Mentor from GitHub (see Install TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository)
      
        The TEAM Mentor root folder should contain the following folders:
DocsToolsLibrary_Data (Note: Only the zip file will have this 
directory, for TM cloned from GitHub this directory will automatically 
be created on first run of TM)TeamMentor\Publish\Website.3.5 (This folder contains TEAM Mentor release binaries, IIS Web site use this folder)
      
        
          Add TEAM Mentor to IIS 7.0.
        
        
          Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". 
          Navigate to the "Sites" folder in the "Connections" tree on the left. 
          Right click on the "Sites" folder.
          Select "Add Web Site...” An "Add Web Site" window should appear. 
          Enter a name for the site in the "Site name:" text box. 
          Click the "..." next to the "Physical path:" text box to set the root of the web site. A "Browse for Folder" window should appear. 
          Select to the "TeamMentor\Publish\Website.3.5" folder inside the TEAM Mentor root folder  
          Click "Ok". Set the port in the "Port:" text box, if necessary. 
          Click "OK".
          The "Add Web Site" window should close and a new web site should appear in the "Sites" folder in the tree on the left of the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager" window.
          A new web site should appear in the tree structure on the left of the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager" window. 
        
      
      
        Set up SSL. SSL is enabled by default for TEAM Mentor. Therefore it is necessary to set up SSL certificate. (Note: It is possible to disable SSL configuration)
      
        First generate a CSR
        
          
          
        
        
          
            Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". 
          
          Double click on the "Server Certificates" menu in the "Security" section 
          
            From the "Actions" menu click on "Create Certificate Request."
          
          
            Follow the Wizzard to create the CSR
          
          
            Send the CSR to your Certificate Authority for Signing
          
        
        
          
          
        
        
Install your certificate
        
          
            Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".
            
          
          Double click on the "Server Certificates" menu in the "Security" section
          From the "Actions" menu click on "Complete Certificate Request.
          "Browse" for your SSL Certificate file received from the Certificate Authority, then Click Next. Follow the rest of the wizard steps until finished.
          Now assign the certificate to the newly created web site. Under "Sites" Select the web site
          From the "action menu" click on "Bindings"
          Click "Add" in the window that just poped up
          Under "type" choose 'https", "IP Address" should be "All"  and the "Port" should be "443"
          The SSL Certificate should be the certificate you just installed. 
          Click OK
        
      
      
        Set up Permissions -  find        the account used by IIS needs to have write privileges to the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folderOn IIS 7 Identify the application account. which is the Windows user account used by the IIS Application Pool configured on the TEAM Mentor website.On the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". Navigate to "Application Pools" in the tree on the left. Right-click on the "Default App Pool" and select "Advanced Settings...” Take note of the user-name in the "Identity" row under "Process Model"By default, it is "NetworkService" On IIS 7.5 the application account name is the same as Application Pool name. This is the Windows user account used by the IIS Application Pool configured on the TEAM Mentor website.On the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".Navigate to "Application Pools" in the tree on the leftFind the Application Pool name, it will be the same as the "Site Name" you have created in step 3 above. Make sure that the .NET Framework version is set to v4.0. Otherwise double click on the Application Pool and set the correct versoinTake a note of the Application Pool name.Adjust the file-system permissions. Give write permissions for the TEAM Mentor folder to the Windows user account that is used to run TEAM Mentor. This is the username that has been discovered in the previous step. Right click on the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folderSelect "Properties". A "Properties" window should appear. Select the "Security" tab in the "Properties" window. Give "Full Access" permissions to the Windows account that is used to run TEAM Mentor. In case of IIS 7.5 give "Full Control" to the account IIS AppPool\<AppPoolName> where the AppPoolName is the name identified above. Click "OK"
span:
You can also do a 
Git Clone of the latest version of TEAM Mentor from GitHub (see Install TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository)
Add TEAM Mentor to IIS 7.0.
Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".
"Server Certificates" menu in the "Security" section
From the "Actions" menu click on "Create Certificate Request."
Follow the Wizzard to create the CSR
Send the CSR to your Certificate Authority for Signing
Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".
"Server Certificates" menu in the "Security" section
the account used by IIS needs to have write privileges to the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder
On IIS 7 Identify the application account. which is the Windows user account used by the
IIS Application Pool configured on the TEAM Mentor website.
On the "Internet
Information Services (IIS) Manager".
Navigate to "Application Pools" in the tree on the left.
Right-click on the "Default App Pool" and select "Advanced Settings...”
Take note of the user-name in the "Identity" row under "Process Model"
By default, it is "NetworkService"
On IIS 7.5 the application account name is the same as Application Pool name. This is the Windows user account used by the
IIS Application Pool configured on the TEAM Mentor website.
On the "Internet
Information Services (IIS) Manager".
Navigate to "Application Pools" in the tree on the left
Find the Application Pool name, it will be the same as the "Site Name" you have created in step 3 above.
Make sure that the .NET Framework version is set to v4.0. Otherwise double click on the Application Pool and set the correct versoin
Take a note of the Application Pool name.
Adjust the file-system permissions. Give write permissions for the TEAM Mentor folder
to the Windows user account that is used to run TEAM Mentor. This is the username that
has been discovered in the previous step.
Right click on the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder
Select "Properties". A "Properties" window
should appear.
Select the "Security" tab in the "Properties" window. Give "Full Access"
permissions to the Windows account that is used to run TEAM Mentor.
In case of IIS 7.5 give "Full Control" to the account IIS AppPool\<AppPoolName> where the AppPoolName is the name identified above.
Click "OK"

b: On IIS 7 Identify the application account.
On IIS 7.5 the application account name is the same as Application Pool name.
a: TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository

links.text: TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository

html:
If you want to use the application locally only, use Cassini. If you want to expose the application on a web server to your team, use IIS. 

To install TEAM Mentor on IIS 7.0 and IIS 7.5:
  1. Copy TEAM Mentor files to local folder
    • Download the .zip file of TEAM Mentor and extract it
    • You can also do a Git Clone of the latest version of TEAM Mentor from GitHub (see Install TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository)
  2. The TEAM Mentor root folder should contain the following folders:
    • Docs
    • Tools
    • Library_Data (Note: Only the zip file will have this directory, for TM cloned from GitHub this directory will automatically be created on first run of TM)
    • TeamMentor\Publish\Website.3.5 (This folder contains TEAM Mentor release binaries, IIS Web site use this folder)
  3. Add TEAM Mentor to IIS 7.0.
    • Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". 
    • Navigate to the "Sites" folder in the "Connections" tree on the left. 
    • Right click on the "Sites" folder.
    • Select "Add Web Site...” An "Add Web Site" window should appear. 
    • Enter a name for the site in the "Site name:" text box. 
    • Click the "..." next to the "Physical path:" text box to set the root of the web site. A "Browse for Folder" window should appear. 
    • Select to the "TeamMentor\Publish\Website.3.5" folder inside the TEAM Mentor root folder  
    • Click "Ok". Set the port in the "Port:" text box, if necessary. 
    • Click "OK".
    • The "Add Web Site" window should close and a new web site should appear in the "Sites" folder in the tree on the left of the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager" window.
    • A new web site should appear in the tree structure on the left of the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager" window. 
  4. Set up SSL. SSL is enabled by default for TEAM Mentor. Therefore it is necessary to set up SSL certificate. (Note: It is possible to disable SSL configuration)
    1. First generate a CSR
      • Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". 
      • Double click on the "Server Certificates" menu in the "Security" section
      • From the "Actions" menu click on "Create Certificate Request."
      • Follow the Wizzard to create the CSR
      • Send the CSR to your Certificate Authority for Signing
    2. Install your certificate
      • Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".
      • Double click on the "Server Certificates" menu in the "Security" section
      • From the "Actions" menu click on "Complete Certificate Request.
      • "Browse" for your SSL Certificate file received from the Certificate Authority, then Click Next. Follow the rest of the wizard steps until finished.
      • Now assign the certificate to the newly created web site. Under "Sites" Select the web site
      • From the "action menu" click on "Bindings"
      • Click "Add" in the window that just poped up
      • Under "type" choose 'https", "IP Address" should be "All"  and the "Port" should be "443"
      • The SSL Certificate should be the certificate you just installed.
      • Click OK

  5. Set up Permissions -  find the account used by IIS needs to have write privileges to the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder
    • On IIS 7 Identify the application account. which is the Windows user account used by the IIS Application Pool configured on the TEAM Mentor website.
      • On the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". 
      • Navigate to "Application Pools" in the tree on the left. 
      • Right-click on the "Default App Pool" and select "Advanced Settings...” 
      • Take note of the user-name in the "Identity" row under "Process Model"
      • By default, it is "NetworkService" 
    • On IIS 7.5 the application account name is the same as Application Pool name. This is the Windows user account used by the IIS Application Pool configured on the TEAM Mentor website.
      • On the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".
      • Navigate to "Application Pools" in the tree on the left
      • Find the Application Pool name, it will be the same as the "Site Name" you have created in step 3 above.
      • Make sure that the .NET Framework version is set to v4.0. Otherwise double click on the Application Pool and set the correct versoin
      • Take a note of the Application Pool name.
    • Adjust the file-system permissions. Give write permissions for the TEAM Mentor folder to the Windows user account that is used to run TEAM Mentor. This is the username that has been discovered in the previous step. 
      • Right click on the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder
      • Select "Properties". A "Properties" window should appear. 
      • Select the "Security" tab in the "Properties" window. Give "Full Access" permissions to the Windows account that is used to run TEAM Mentor.
      • In case of IIS 7.5 give "Full Control" to the account IIS AppPool\<AppPoolName> where the AppPoolName is the name identified above.
      • Click "OK"
